website_summaries.verdict: The best pair of fully armored gloves, sporting a combination of plastic, metal, and heavy fabric protection.
pros: Metal protection around the digits prevents many forms of abrasions and minor impact injuries around the joints
Lighter fabric and rubber padding keep the upper sides of the hands protected without restricting movement
cons: Gloves are not waterproof or insulated for cold weather use

website_summaries.verdict: Offers the most amount of protection for motorcycle gloves and extreme sport-use with extra padding for the joints.
pros: Uses a lightweight alloy steel to protect the individual joints of each finger
Knuckle cover design allows each finger to move freely without restriction or discomfort
cons: Hands sweat in these gloves more than traditional motorcycle options

customer_reviews.title: Im gonna buy again
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves a month ago loved em very comfortable. 2 days ago i laid my bike down at 70 mph on my way to reno street vibrations the gloves ripped open but my hands were 100% protected the metal knuckles and palm supports worked perfect. Bottom line. These gloves did their job
customer_reviews.author: Francisco aviles

customer_reviews.title: Had a major accident with these on!! Read.
customer_reviews.text: A driver waiting in the middle lane did not yield before she turned left and I got hit by her. I flew off my bike and was airborne about 4 seconds before I hit the ground where I was scrapping and sliding on the ground for about 6 more feet. The gloves got torn up but my hands remain scratch less as if nothing happened to them. Check out the pictures. It's a miracle I'm alive right now. Ride safe guys. This is a great purchase but it's a one and done deal. Buy new ones if you get in a wreck.
customer_reviews.author: flexforall1

customer_reviews.title: Held up to wreck.
customer_reviews.text: These held up to a motorcycle wreck at county highway speeds. Front tire went to outside-left on turn, so rider did a sort-of high-side superman. Slid about 40 ft on asphalt then 40 feet in grass. see attached pictures. Palm plates were ground down as well as some knuckle damage. Had minor scrapes on hands. Would definately buy again. Comfort level was adequate.
customer_reviews.author: cwb

customer_reviews.title: Once their replacements arrive, I doubt I'll use them much
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Very breathable. When my hands are sweaty, these are my go-to gloves Con: I bought these because I needed touchscreen compatible gloves with good protection. These said they were touchscreen compatible. *SPOILER ALERT* They are NOT compatible with my touchscreen, not even with the sensitivity turned up. These gloves had three jobs to do: protect my hands, let them breathe and let me use my phone when necessary, and they failed at one of them. So I had to buy another pair of different gloves that actually are touchscreen compatible, but those gloves don't have all the protection these do. I wish these had worked.
customer_reviews.author: El Sancho Grande

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Gloves! --> For a Clown!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are a complete disaster! The "pinky" fingers are nearly as long as the middle and ring fingers - Who on Earth has hands like that?? Beyond that, they feel and look so very cheap with the little rubber areas all over the gloves which not only look like garbage but are ready to fall off. Lastly, the ghastly steel knuckles are in an area that, by simulating an impact on my kitchen counter, one can see they are not up the the task in regards to where they are positioned. Total and compete garbage gloves that are going back!
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: They look cool...but that’s all.
customer_reviews.text: They look cool, but that’s it. Very uncomfortable on the inside. They feel like rough yard work gloves, and actually that’s literally what they look like but with plastic and metal looking parts stuck on the outside like cosplayers do. You can feel the rough edges where stitched together on the inside. Externally 2 of the fingers were stitched loosely and threads were coming loose and hanging off. Will try washing them/breaking them in to see if they get softer as gloves typically do. May try turning them inside out to cut off some of the excess material that is making them uncomfortable. But they do look cool... These would probably be better as paintball gloves or cosplay.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Initial impressions
customer_reviews.text: I just got these in the mail today. They seem well built, however, the inside might have a few "hot spots" due to stitching and where the metal and armor rubs. The inside is kind of fleece lined/soft, which I could see being hot in the summer. The protection seems on point though, theres a hard plastic spot where you would slide on your palm, and the knuckles are made of real steel, and the plastic is not flimsy at all! I bought these after I wore through my Mechanix M-Pact gloves in one season, so we will see how these hold up! They definitely aren't as comfortable as the mechanix, but have a lot more protection.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These did not last long before stitching started coming out ...
customer_reviews.text: These did not last long before stitching started coming out of the velcro tab holding the right glove on at the wrist. Then the left glove stitching started to give away at the wrist, on the palm side between the cuff and the palm pad. I would rather have put this money towards a 50+ pair that would last at least the entire summer season. I purchased these 09 Mar 2017, Its 02 Aug now. I have been living with these stitching issues for about a month now. So these are being replaced today, at my cost.
customer_reviews.author: lgajohnymac

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: I bought these based on the reviews of people that had crashed and survived. I like to be safe while riding. I'll wear at minimum gloves and a helmet because I care about my head and I care about my hands. These gloves are comfortable and easy to put on and off. My hands breathe while riding through the heat and they don't come out sweaty. Sometimes the glove will catch on my watch but I can move my watch and it's not an issue after that.
customer_reviews.author: Collinchan321

customer_reviews.title: Look great! Terrible fit!
customer_reviews.text: I wear medium gloves and their size chart agreed so that's what I ordered and received. Once I actually got one on, a ten minute struggle, the fit was perfect and the touch screen fingertip actually worked but another uncomfortable battle getting it off! The problem in getting them on and off is because the opening for your hand is ridiculously small! Probably very good gloves as the one fit perfectly and was quite comfortable EXCEPT for the on and off issue. I couldn't even get the second glove on! Redesign definitely in order. Too bad as they look great! Returning for refund.
customer_reviews.author: SAMitchell

customer_reviews.title: what's Owen Wilson's favorite word?
customer_reviews.text: I use this as my wheelchair gloves and thought that they didn't last as long as I would like. Someone asked me how long did I have them for and when I told them they said "that sounds about right" so I guess it lasted as long as any pair of gloves would have. I do wish it was more durable still, and I like the way it looks. the carbon knuckle save my hands when going through tight doorways or from around corners to quick. Also whenever people see them, they have something good to say usually starting with "wow"
customer_reviews.author: Joseph L. Newson Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Takes a minute to get used to the knuckles but after that.. great gloves with great fit
customer_reviews.text: Wasnt sure how i would like these. Also not sure about the comfort with the hard knuckles and all. Well. Took a minute to get used to the knuckles. But after that man, they r comfortable for all day ridin and being pre-curved makes them just a little less fatiguing thru a long ride!! From the feel of them i woukd inagine they would definitely do their job in case if an accident. Hope i dont have to update that info later!! I am even able to wear liners underneath when its cold!! Great gloves. Quality leather. Fit is superb. Would highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Deirdriu

customer_reviews.title: Wow, pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: Gambled on these because the velcro failed on my alpinestars. Lets just say these are better than my Alpinestars SMX 2 gloves. There's more protection and the velcro is better. The only problem with these is that the thumb on the right hand is sewn weird, different from the left hand. It causes the thumb to be point like I have long pointer fingernails or something. But apart from that, these are worth every penny. I'd have given it a 5 star if there wasn't inconsistency with the stitching. The size measurements were spot on, I usually wear a L in other gloves but for these according to the chart I should be an XL, and it was right on
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Awesome summer riding gloves
customer_reviews.text: I love the look and feel of the gloves. The touch screen tips on the finger and thumb work perfectly. My only complaint would be that the pinky finger has about 1/4" of extra glove at the tip but all the other fingers fit all the way to the tips... It's not a big deal but you do notice it.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Cool looking, crash protection is lacking
customer_reviews.text: They've got a cool video all over FB about these gloves. They fit well and as expected, and the metal protective bits are good looking and the touchscreen compatibility is nice. I'm not thinking I'm going to run my hands over any knives (as per the ad) any time soon, so not a huge selling point. Thin, non-padded gloves that will at best leave one with massive bruising of the hands in a fall. The ARE well ventilated, though, and should be much less sweaty than a pair of full leather gauntlet gloves. I'll see how they treat me for a season. At the price, they're worth replacing annually if they turn out to be durable.
customer_reviews.author: Uriel

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price, barely
customer_reviews.text: I don't normally write reviews but I couldn't find any reviews for the leather version of these gloves. They're comfortable but by no means the best gloves. They have no perforations or other way of venting. They fit snug in a good way and don't bother me too much while riding. My previous pair of gloves were some $50 bilt gloves and those were way better. Pros: they're cheap Stylish Would protect in the event of accident Cons: they have no ventilation They aren't precurved like most riding gloves A few cheap looking plastic parts ruin the "serious biker aesthetic"
customer_reviews.author: Sandy & Travis

customer_reviews.title: Great other than the stitching
customer_reviews.text: I loved these gloves (bought in April) and the touchscreen capabilities. Although, it's very location specific, it works great after you train yourself to it's location. On the other hand (no pun intended), the stitching ripped while putting them on for work this morning. I would like a replacement or some kind of contact from the seller - never dropped or abused.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Hudgins

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: **update** **crashed** Hit a stationary object at 70mph and flew 140 feet. The gloves were scraped to crap. But nothing broke through the fabric, as it has metal at all the right places. My hands are 100% fine. Not even a bruise. Original: I feel bad ass wearing them. Light. Seem very protective. Haven't ridden a whole lot with them though.
customer_reviews.author: May

customer_reviews.title: A WHOLE FINGER MISSING!!??!!!??
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the package! THE PINKY WAS MISSING!! Looks like it was bit off by a dog or something. I literally had to laugh when I saw it. Plus the threading on it looks like it's about to unravel so I question its durability. I spoke to their customer service and can't get it replaced because they don't have anymore in stock in the US (that's what they said). The fit is okay but I would've preferred it to be a little tighter. My suggestion, if your hand measurement is on the lower end of the measuring chart, you may want to consider going down a size.
customer_reviews.author: Bern

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I really like these gloves. They are very comfortable and fit well. I have done some riding in the mist and did not have any problems with my hands getting wet. However, they are not wind-resistant. My hands do get cold if the weather is cold, but that is ok. These gloves are designed for fair weather and allow your hands to stay cool when it is sunny outside.
customer_reviews.author: johniii

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I decided to buy these gloves after going down on an old pair of Alpinestars that protected most of my hands, except for the lower knuckles. These gloves have good reviews and seems to have pictures as proof, so I bought these gloves. I have aluminum grips on my bike and these gloves make it feel as if they are rubber, these gloves just have a good grip to them.. These gloves are very comfortable and seem to be holding up so far.
customer_reviews.author: Ripcord

customer_reviews.title: Looks to be a very safe product, but doesn't live up to all advertising.
customer_reviews.text: Not a terribly bad looking glove, and as far as protection it looks like it should be good for any scrapes I may do in the future. I'm mainly rating this down because they are not truthful in their advertising, so it makes it hard to trust that they're going to have consistent quality. These gloves do NOT work with touchscreen on my Note 8, and I'll have to be buying conductive thread (as another answer'er (?) noted) just to see if I can get that to work. It's fairly important that I have some touchscreen functionality so I'll have to use my old gloves until I can get that done.
customer_reviews.author: R. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good summer gloves, but less protection than full leather
customer_reviews.text: These gloves fit well and appear well constructed. I have taken to wearing them and my hands feel protected even though they are mostly cloth. The airflow through them is fine. I expect the protection is a bit lower than leather would be, but the hard plastic bits seem to be in the right places, and there's even added plastic bit on the outside edge of the palms which is smart because when you fall you tend to put the palm down and this would protect from the shearing somewhat.
customer_reviews.author: Reg71

customer_reviews.title: Cool gloves
customer_reviews.text: I bought the "ILM Steel Knuckle Motorcycle ATV Motocross Dirt Bike Racing BMX MX Downhill Tactical Gloves (M, BLACK)" model, so, full fabric fingers with little steel ovals on each non-thumb + steel knuckles. They get a lot of positive comments when I'm working out in the town. :) I had to snip off the thumb side guards, they don't flex well with the joints, other than that, great gloves. Not compatible with my touch screen phone. Not waterproof either, very cold, but that's not what these are for!
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: Knockoff
customer_reviews.text: Those silver shining metal looking bad ass knuckles actually do nothing. They’re just for decoration. They do nothing to protect you and actually quite on the contrary it feels very hard on your hand. The The touch screen actually works flawlessly well I was very surprised of how good the touch response on my cell phone was with these cheap gloves
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Pretty significant design flaw
customer_reviews.text: Fairly aesthetic but there were a few issues in terms of comfort. The hard rubber anterior thumb guard tends to press into my knuckle when gripping and will cause a bruise. This is far more apparent if the weather is colder and the rubber is less flexible. Also the material and design on the palm surface looks and feels similar to gardening gloves. I did get comments on the looks so there is that to consider.
customer_reviews.author: Ver. Ka

customer_reviews.title: Best riding gloves I ever had
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are absolutely fantastic. The palms really let the you grip the handlebars of your without worrying about slipping, while also providing a decent amount of protection should you fall. They really look and feel sturdy and durable, and I have no doubt that will last for quite sometime. They really provide great comfort and the airflow through the gloves really keeps your hands cool even during the summer (rode my bike in 96+ F. and my hands stayed cool and comfortable the entire time.) I HIGHLY recommend these gloves for warm weather riding, infact I love these gloves so much, I bought the winter version for myself.
customer_reviews.author: S. Seibert

customer_reviews.title: Warning ruined palms do not get.
customer_reviews.text: I went down on my bike these did not protect my hands much. I should have worn my other gloves but the reviews on here sounded so promising. NEVER AGAIN. Buying some 100 dollar gloves as these are not worth it. Your hands are too important please get yourself something that will keep you from harm. Gloves ripped in half.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Chen

customer_reviews.title: Not the best but worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Take a bit to break in so they di fit a bit snug at first but once you ride a few times they do get comfortable. With that being said the quality of the leather is kinda crapy to be honest but was expecting that with the price tag. Also these are NOT winter gloves by any means in 35° weather my fingers were frozen but I live in the south so will be great in the summer
customer_reviews.author: Drunkbuyer33

customer_reviews.title: Poor build quality
customer_reviews.text: These were falling apart right out of the box. The stitching was coming out on the wrists on both gloves, leaving gaps. Also, while the fingers are fine for large hands, the wrists are a bit too tight so it's hard to get them on and off. The materials seem good, but the build quality is poor.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Torture Chambers for your hands!
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for these gloves, but alas unless you are a masochist these gloves are some the most uncomfortable I've worn for motorcycling. The glove fingers were too short (except the pinky finger which was far too long) resulting in my digits jamming against the ends. Instead of the the sewn seams being on the outside there were numerous seamed edges internally and the metal "armor" did not sit atop my knuckles. Even if I had exchanged for a larger size the seam edges and poor fit would still have been extremely uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis W.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gloves!
customer_reviews.text: My fiance LOVES his new gloves! They fit perfectly and he cannot wait to wear them driving his bike :) Everything about these are great! Love how they are protected in every spot on tour hand. The palm part is protected too. Would buy again. Would 100% reccomend. Also, touch screen works great too! 10 out of 10 reccomend.
customer_reviews.author: US

customer_reviews.title: It's okay medium size gloves
customer_reviews.text: I am a seasonal rider and I notice that the fingers are a bit longer. The plastics rubs against my knuckles and leaves a slight skin irritation. I only use this for short rides and for matching outfit colors. I haven't use the touch screen features because the fingers are long and don't use my phone while riding.
customer_reviews.author: c sanantonio

customer_reviews.title: Very tight around the wrist, very hard to get on.
customer_reviews.text: The wrist hole is so small, that it's almost impossible to get my hands into the glove, and o ce in, the surface area for my knuckles doesn't line up with my knuckles. There are also A lot of hard surfaces on these gloves that have no paddingg behind them, making it very rough to use them. But, the leather is good quality, and they do surprisingly well in the cold. But I won't be using them because they're too uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Echani Van'der Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Love These Gloves For Around Town Riding!!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these gloves!!! They're super comfortable and fit great! Haven't wore them in the rain, so I can't speak on the water resistance but this is my 2nd par (lost 1st pair) and definitely recommend these for cruising around town. I don't race or go to the track, so I can't recommend them for that, but for everyday riding they are Great!!!
customer_reviews.author: Everything Barber & More

customer_reviews.title: Good for 60 days.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: looks cool made with real leather very comfortable to wear has protection for the fingers and knuckles. Also has some light protection on the inside Palm. Cons: In less than 60 days it has ripped at the wrist and it's a hole in the left index finger. Rendering the glove absolutely useless.
customer_reviews.author: Misguided

customer_reviews.title: The wrist is way to tight
customer_reviews.text: Once it’s on it fits pretty well. But getting it on is really hard. The wrist is super tight. Like almost impossible to get the second glove on. Unfortunately I decided to just deal with it, and hope it stretch’s out some. Then I accidentally ripped the Velcro strap off.... definitely don’t recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Valiukas

customer_reviews.title: high quality gloves that provide vital protection while looking good doing it!!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality leather gloves.... love the metal protection in case you fall unexpectedly.... i bought the largest size.... a little small but they do still fit. From my understanding they will stretch some over time with use. Definitely works using a phone too.... I say give these gloves a try!
customer_reviews.author: robert dunn

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly thin and cool.
customer_reviews.text: These look pretty resilient in the pictures but the overall material is thin and the wind goes through it very easily and they are very cool. I will not be able to use these in cold weather. I was really counting on them being much thicker and more protective. They feel like if I did go down and landed on my palms they would shred instantly and provide hardly any protection.
customer_reviews.author: Brick Wall

customer_reviews.title: They do the job
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty good motorcycle gloves. I haven't had a tumble or anything yet, so I've no idea how much the palm guard would actually protect me, but they're comfortable enough. Pretty much no rain protection tho, they're definitely for 'fair weather riding'. When I got caught in a downpour and the sun came out, they did dry off pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Fatch Racall

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I really like the gloves and you cant beat the price. The protection is good and keeps my hands warm. It has taken me a few rides to get used to the gloves, using blinkers and switching to high beams. I would recommend these to any one new to riding or looking for an inexpensive alternative to some name brands.
customer_reviews.author: brandon

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves not metal, plastic.
customer_reviews.text: A little disappointed in the description vs. what it actually is, no steel at all in the knuckles just shiny metallic paint over plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: No idea how these are so highly reviewed. Poor quality, the steel inserts aren’t very solid and the glove just feels really cheap to me. Also you don’t want steel. If you crash the steel bends and stays bent trapping your knuckles and fingers. There’s much better materials like carbon fiber and even hard plastics that handle road rash and impact much better.
customer_reviews.author: zack

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice easy slip on and off
customer_reviews.text: Shiny nice looking easy slip on and comfortable for that long trip to the beach or out of state it's not for use with a touch screen for sure and I am not sure about its water resistance when I did ride in the rain it was like a twenty minute ride I did not remember My hands being wet it that's helps.
customer_reviews.author: Alex T.

customer_reviews.title: Nobody will mess with you if you wearing these gloves!!!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves look BAD ASS!!! I've received many compliments on them. I could do without the 'Madbike' logo on the back - but definitely not a deal breaker. They have plenty of grip for hard riding, are very comfortable, and easy to get on/off. Careful around pipes though - or the material on the fingers will melt.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W. Childs

customer_reviews.title: Short Thumbs and Index Fingers
customer_reviews.text: I have the exact same glove in the winter version. The fit is perfect and the gloves keep the hands warm and dry. The summer gloves seem to have shorter fingers and thumbs, thus the inseams place pressure on the tips of the index fingers and thumbs. After only a few minutes of riding the gloves become unbearable to wear. The proper sizing for my hands is XL.
customer_reviews.author: stevecast

customer_reviews.title: Solid Gloves For The Money
customer_reviews.text: I never ride without these gloves on. It's great having the piece of mind that my hands are protected, and they don't hinder my ability to operate the bike. In fact, it feels weird hopping on without wearing them. They seem to be well made. I used mine all summer with no real signs of wear. They allow a decent amount of airflow, enough that they're not uncomfortable in 100+ weather.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Avoid. Not a motorcycle glove at all, would not want to wreck with these, extremely thin.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Appel

customer_reviews.title: Nice fit, not water proof, still worth it.
customer_reviews.text: They fit nice. Little tight but they break in after a few uses. These are not water proof. I still like them. Havent worn them in the summer but these are not made for winter. My hands freeze on the 15 minute ride home on the freeway from work. (Mind you its just in the 50s not even raining or snowing but they still get cold on freeway)
customer_reviews.author: Agustin

customer_reviews.title: Great looks poorly made.
customer_reviews.text: Ok the gloves look amazing but they are like wearing sponges in the rain even after I sprayed them with a water protection. But I can deal with that the thing I can't deal with is the hook and loop or in civilian words Velcro lasted two months now I have to go buy Velcro and fix them but I might take them in to have a button put on professionally.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Comfort Comfort comfort
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best pair I've owned so far and they fit perfectly around my wrist before my wrist would be numb and my hand will fall asleep didn't know it was the glove that was doing it I've been wearing these for just over a month and that problem has gone away.
customer_reviews.author: James Durkins

customer_reviews.title: Order a size larger than you would normally
customer_reviews.text: The gloves are good for their price point but the size chart is a not accurate . The gloves are too small to be comfortable at this time . Im hoping they will stretch out and wear better. Looks are exactly what I wanted and other than the tightness they are exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.author: J.Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price. Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: Cool! Almost fit to perfect, any smaller and they wouldn't have fit. I have probably a lil smaller than large hands and these are right at my fingertips, the fit is perfect. You get what you pay for, the material, all though nice, will not be warm in the winter, i do feel that the outer protection and palm are going to work very well. I definitely would recommend these. Very good quality for a cheap pair of gloves. Update: been using these gloves everyday, they feel and perform great. The weird nobby bumps at the bottom actually help with maintaining speed with less stress on my hands.
customer_reviews.author: Lionheart237

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price
customer_reviews.text: This gloves are actually better than what I expected . The wind comes in so you dont get sweaty hands .. they work with toch screens and are easy to put on and take of 2 Ive had them for less than a week but been using them all the time dont know about durability yet but if they break or something Ill buy another pair
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Nice bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: Ill update the warmth aspect when its get cold. But gloves fit very well and are comfortable while riding. Pretty much used them everyday since I received them and they have held up pretty well. No tears, cuts, ect. Good glove so far
customer_reviews.author: Stephen D

customer_reviews.title: Meduim fit like a large, good quality, nice design
customer_reviews.text: Better than fair price for these gloves, they look great, feel nice but run a little bit big. I did take the perm sharpie to the knuckle metal, sometimes they would give a little sun reflection. I'd buy these again for sure.
customer_reviews.author: AJ Clearwater

customer_reviews.title: Dint waste your money on these.
customer_reviews.text: For $20 they are a very mediocre pair of gloves. The look cool and have plenty of air flow but that's about it. They are very cheaply made and only last about a month of consistant riding. I went through 2 pairs with in 3 months, with the same issues. They literally start coming apart from the seams. Pull table are cheap and will rip off. Latex print on the gloves falls off, and if you buy the mesh ones and get them wet, you might as well throw them away. Very poorly made product. Dont waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Astrid

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves at an insanely low cost
customer_reviews.text: I’m just getting into MX so I’m sure there are better options, that said, these have been through a track day and 3 trail days. Gone down multiple times all days and washed these after each day. Holding up great!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher R. Tinker

customer_reviews.title: Finally found a GOOD glove!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these gloves. I'm the kind of guy that needs a thin palm while riding and these fit the bill perfectly while at the same time providing heavy duty knuckle protection. How much? You can backhand pine 2x4's with these hard enough to dent the wood and not really feel too much. Took them out for a 150 mile ride last night and they worked like a charm. One thing to note: These are not for cold weather riding, but for summers in Texas they are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Send they back right away if they don't fit.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these gloves but for some reason they made the glove width ok but the fingers on the gloves were too long. The worst part is they made the wrist area of the glove way too tight, I just bought these gloves and they already have torn (area around wrist). I cannot say i'd ever reccomend these gloves to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves.
customer_reviews.text: It is hard to buy a pair of gloves that you cannot try on. However, I am very pleased with these. They look very cool, are built very sturdy, the fit is great if you follow the sizing guide, and they look very durable. They perfectly fit my wants and needs. Oh, I purchased them for riding motorcycles.
customer_reviews.author: KeyserSozae

customer_reviews.title: Super bad ass
customer_reviews.text: Love these driving gloves. I drive a low rider, gangster looking, muscle car. These gloves add to the look that I like. And I have used them to crunch apart frozen items and don't feel a thing. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: Comfort - looks and protection.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very satisfied with the gloves. They're very comfortable -- look great -- and although I haven't gone down with the bike (thank God) they appear to be sufficient for protecting my hands; which is important to me since I'm a chiropractor. For the money these gloves are more than worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Victor

customer_reviews.title: Great deal, true fit, good if you ever need to punch an angry troll.
customer_reviews.text: So far I really like these. Very, attractive and seem to be good construction. The fit was true to the chart. The curve to the fingers isn't tight but helps a little to keep you from having to grip the throttle against the cut of non motorcycle gloves. the pad at the base of the palm touches the throttle a little, but didn't notice it after five minutes and hasn't bothered me since. Plus I'd rather have that pad there as insurance against ever going down. Will update if any cons arise.
customer_reviews.author: Angry Hamster

customer_reviews.title: Had promise - needed to return
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased many different gloves of this kind, always in XL. I was really excited when I took these out of the package. Not only did the protection on the knuckles look and feel substantial, they looked really badass. Unfortunately, these gloves didn't only run too small for my hands, the armored knuckles didn't align with my actual knuckles. Slightly small I could have dealt with, but for the protective pieces to not line up with the parts that needed to be protected, this needed to be returned.
customer_reviews.author: Kiwanji

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves !!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband and he turned around and bought 5 more because he gave them out to his friends. He said these gloves were comfortable and helped his knuckles at work. He said they were soft yet sturdy and hard where the padding needed to be to protect the top parts of his hands as well as the palms of them as well. Highly recommend this product for anyone that is a Motorcyclist or anyone that works with your hands alot. Perfect Glove !!!!
customer_reviews.author: becky

customer_reviews.title: Great protection
customer_reviews.text: Excellent protection they do take a while of getting used to and it is a little hard to use on touch screens maybe because mine are a tattoo loose but overall I want these protecting my hands
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: These gloves are great summer gloves
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy knuckle protection. Easy to put on... could definitely be a bit more comfortable but they arent too bad. I could tell the protection on the knuckles and palm would help if I ever fall. Great summer gloves!
customer_reviews.author: SotoFam

customer_reviews.title: make sure to go UP a size before you order
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my son for Christmas..He loves em!! Says theyre comfortable... Grips his handlebars perfectly and the steel knuckles are a great touch. If ordering...keep in mind these are made in China and their hands arent as big as Americans so go UP a size before you order. Youll thank me later!!!
customer_reviews.author: Exhstd

customer_reviews.title: Very thin an has steel knuckle guards. Great for summer
customer_reviews.text: No indulation so not very good in winter. Will be excellent in summer. Looks luke they can take a good fall. Havent layed mine down so not surevof protectulion. Look and feel like they can take a good spill
customer_reviews.author: Brandon J.

customer_reviews.title: Broke before 1st use
customer_reviews.text: My husband ordered these but they broke the first time he tried them on. Thinking that he just had huge ogre hands he ordered a size up (XL) with the same results. Fyi, he is NOT a big boy.
customer_reviews.author: alexander

customer_reviews.title: Worst gloves I’ve ever worn
customer_reviews.text: These gloves have nothing going for them. There’s little to no grip on the palms, the sloppy stitches irritate my fingers from the inside and the gloves feels cheap all together. AVOID!!! I returned mine. After one use, the stitches began to unravel.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: XL for hobbits
customer_reviews.text: I ordered an XL which is what I wear in normal gloves and every other motorcycle gloves I've bought. These things were so ridiculously small I couldn't even squeeze my hand in. I have them to my friend who wears a medium small and they fit perfect. Not even my girlfriend who wears a medium could put them on. The plastic slider is very bulky, like a tacked on after thought. Really it's not a great glove, or even a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Project Venecia

customer_reviews.title: Decent glove for the price.
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are pretty comfortable. Not bad for the price. I wish that the fingers were just a bit longer. I wear an XL and ordered an XL after reading the reviews. They fit good but are just a bit short. I would order these again. They keep my hands cool while driving.
customer_reviews.author: J. Costello

customer_reviews.title: The best !!!
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this item I expected cheap riding gloves but to be honest they exceeded my expectations. They have very good quality. They fit me perfectly, feels great on hand and I will buy these gloves again. UPDATE (06-21-2018) last year I crashed. Hit the pole at 50 mph. I had injuries but as for my hands I had barely any scratches. These gloves saved my hands. And 6 month before I had another accident. 70 mph on the highway I slammed into the back of the truck. Went flying and gliding on the highway. Not even a scratch on my hands. If I could give this 6 stars I wouldve done it
customer_reviews.author: F8

customer_reviews.title: At this point I would buy again
customer_reviews.text: So far they seem to be good gloves the first and second fingers are a little bit short for me my fingers fit in them I just don't have that little bit of extra room I like. They are definitely not winter gloves. When you undo the velcro strap at the wrist they are easy to get on.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Fine for the price.
customer_reviews.text: For an inexpensive glove this is fine. Ordered the XL as I have large hands and expected it to fit a bit small. The rubber crisscross padding on the palm is already peeling after one use though. Though the outside of the glove seems fairly sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: 80's tough guy
customer_reviews.text: If you want to look like a tough guy from the 80's or a Michael Jackson backup dancer you are in luck! If you want to protect your hands, I think you should be in good shape, but the palm side of the hand will look a lot worse than the top of the hand post crash.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Water = Black hands
customer_reviews.text: Light or heavy rain: Black hands. Do not recommend if planning long trips. Comfort: 3/5.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Angel Betancur F

customer_reviews.title: $20 gloves can't go wrong
customer_reviews.text: I will say this they look cool and sizing fit pretty good on my hand. Feels very plasticky, but durable enough. The Palms have a very good non-slip grip. The only thing that annoys me more than anything is the pinky doesn't fit right, I think there's some other reviews on this too, it's just too long or doesn't fit. Also the fingers themselves are a little loose too. All in all you get what you pay for its 20 bucks and hey it's better than nothing. And again I think they look cool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good buy for the money
customer_reviews.text: I like the feel that if I go down the top of my hand will be protected. It is a real tight fit to get on but once in feels nice.have not rode in rain nor freezing weather so can't say about that but in hot weather they are not miserable had way worse. I sweat easy
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: I always get comments on how cool these gloves are there great high quality gloves everything about them is durable the only thing I would change is the interior it’s bad will make you lose grip of how irritating the material is . not good for punching but definitely good for taking in heavy damage.
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: Good knuckle protection, tears easily between fingers
customer_reviews.text: Gloves are hard once you put them on, I liked the extra protection, but causes stiffness on fingers. Returned because it tore between thumb and index finger the first day
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves great price
customer_reviews.text: Very nice gloves love the fit the only thing I don't care for much is the seam at the tips of the fingers are a lil thick and uncomfortable at times other than that they are great gloves haven't had to put them to the wreck test yet hopefully won't ever have to. Love the metal knuckles!! 👊
customer_reviews.author: The Real DC

customer_reviews.title: ... fit a bit snug but they do fit would recommend a bigger size if you have thick hands
customer_reviews.text: For a XL they do fit a bit snug but they do fit would recommend a bigger size if you have thick hands. The metal is a nice add on I read a review that said it was thin so I was a bit sceptical but after seeing my brothers I decided to buy a pair and I can say it's not thin metal. And yes the fingers do work on your phone.
customer_reviews.author: cameron

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: These feel really good have great grip, luckily I have not tested the skid resistants and hope I never do but I feel confident wearing them. For the money I think you would be hard pressed to find a better pair, would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Moore

customer_reviews.title: Crashed at 70mph
customer_reviews.text: Ok so I got into a total wreck 3 weeks ago, downed at 70mph. Paramedics on scene said I would be dead if I didn’t have my helmet and gear on, I had to take time off to recover. My gloves completely tore up, my right hand intact with completely torn up gloves don’t know how, but my left palm was left blooded with a cut on my thumb. I got out really good, and they are comfortable for riding but I race and if I went down over 100 these gloves wouldn’t have cut it. For maximum protection I wish I could have had an Alpinestars glove on.
customer_reviews.author: Cecil C

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Gloves That Look GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: When I first opened my package with these gloves I thought they looked absolutely fantastic. I really liked the look, and even though i initially thought the metal might be just for show, they actually feel very well made. I believe these gloves will protect me if i ever fell while riding. The only thing bad about them (which really isnt that bad) is that they have a TON of ventilation which means night riding where I live means my fingers freeze. But they will be great for summer driving. Look no further, get these gloves. They are awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Kory

customer_reviews.title: Quality Piece
customer_reviews.text: I have received both these gloves and the cold weather gloves. These are quality, protective gloves that will last a while. I bought some gloves awhile ago and they ripped. With these, I know for a fact will not only last a very long time but keep my hands protected in case anything were to happen.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Good product, will buy again
customer_reviews.text: It is a good product, a bit misleading but good for me. I modified mine a bit. It's definitely not water resistant as it is made out of breathable mesh. I wish the material lasted a little longer and the velcrow wasnt as easily ripped off. I will be buying more to replace my current pair once it fully falls apart.
customer_reviews.author: FrostyTV

customer_reviews.title: Size is wierd
customer_reviews.text: So I had to order an extra size above my size, XL instead of M-L. Good fit for thumb, index and middle finger. Ring finger and Pinky glove portion is 1-2 CM way too long, what the heck. Not sure what to do here.
customer_reviews.author: Ulieq

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad, wish they were slightly cheaper for the fit and over all quality.
customer_reviews.text: These are very difficult to put on, but fit snug and I would hope they work well if I were to go down while riding. Can tell the gloves aren't cut the same, left goes on easier than the right, right glove is a serious fight to put on. Must be hand cut fabric. So far they're OK for riding, left thumb seem likes to twist around and can be uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: John Victor

customer_reviews.title: Runs big
customer_reviews.text: I really liked these. They are comfortable and well constructed. Unfortunately they didn't fit me. I got the medium and it was still way to big. My pinkies only filled half the finger in the glove. I wish these came in a small.
customer_reviews.author: jessy1012

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves for the money!!!!
customer_reviews.text: A little uncomfortable on the wrist at first but got used to it quickly. Well worth the price and the convenience of not taking gloves off to pause music or change apps etc. I might pick up another pair for back up in case these wear quickly.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Good glove to learn feel
customer_reviews.text: Great starter glove. In a tight ish fit small with alpine star gloves. I bought the medium of this glove. Fit standard out of the box, but because of the mesh, it did stretch a bit in the palm and finger tip area. Overall, I still use it, I just wrap it a bit tighter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The palmar side is really as thin as paper
customer_reviews.text: The first thing I did to test the gloves is to cut/stab it gently with a sharp knife, imagining sharp glass is shattered all over the ground. The palmar side is readily cut through. I would say it offers zero protection to cut. Perhaps the good thing of it is higher dexterity. The dorsal side is reasonably tough. I think you would like to fall in accident only holding a fist with these gloves. Or, you may rely on the small plastic plate at the base of palm.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Choi

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my boyfriend. This is the second purchase. The first pair only lasted a year, but he wanted the same exact ones when replacing them.
customer_reviews.author: SuperSoldier

customer_reviews.title: Good protection kinda thin material but worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Good glove great outer hand protection. The palm material is thin. Not as durable as same style fox gloves but good product.
customer_reviews.author: Flex

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are super strong and meant to protect your hands. Super cool looking also. The sizes are true to fit I believe as I ordered by there measuring diagram and they fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and good phone finger
customer_reviews.text: I live my fox gloves for summer but these are a good for temps 45 F -60 Xl fit perfect, able to use phone not too bulky def best value abd I’ve owned lots of bikes and gloves
customer_reviews.author: Supadave

product_meta.title: ILM Alloy Steel Knuckle Motorcycle Motorbike Powersports Racing Tactical Paintball Gloves (L, BLACK)
feature_bullets: Professional alloy steel protection parts, made by injection molding, 100% full protection, comfortable and fashionable.
Engineered according to the human body. With maximum protection for the joints, the finger joints are made with anti-collision protection.
The outer part of the hand is design using a large area of U type protection, the arch-shape is in accordance with the back of the hand.
The palm was design using a 3D classic plastic non-slip lines to strengthen the anti-slip function.
This glove gives the palm the maximum degree of anti-slip function and a full range of grasping conditions.

specifications.Vehicle Service Type: ATV, Adventure, Scooter, UTV, Cruiser/ Touring, Street Bike, Dirt Bike, Snowmobile, Personal Watercraft
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,354 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
